model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain helpful and detailed information, enabling the Speaker A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT. 

NOTE:
PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY is a summary of the previous dialog, and If the MEMORY contains information that conflicts with the PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY, it is to be regarded as an unhelpful memory.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

PREVIOUS DIALOGUE SUMMARY:
Speaker A has never been out of the United States and thinks it would be nice to visit England.
Speaker A is interested in trying new restaurants, mentioning Taco Bell as their favorite.
Speaker B enjoys fancy restaurants and mentioned Sufi as their favorite in London.

CURRENT DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I went to another martial arts class and had a blast.
Speaker B: That's great, were there a lot of students today? I've been at home working on a project.
Speaker A: Quite a few, but it wasn't too crowded. It was a nice change of scenery. What kind of project are you working on?
Speaker B: I'm sure the student appreciate that. You teach as a group as apposed to one-on-one right? And one of the companies I work for had their system hit with a virus so I've been upgraded their software to debug the system.
Speaker A: I teach group classes and one on one, but I was the student today. I specialize in jiu-jitsu but today I got to be the student in a taekwondo class. 
Speaker B: That's even better, learning is a life-long journey. How are you class on martial art history? When you have time teach me too, I'd love to learn. 
Speaker A: It's been a little stressful lately, because finals are coming up...but I'm confident in that class. I could've aced it before I even started! I'll definitely get started with you after finals.
Speaker B: Ahaha we;; for someone who's so passionate about martial arts I'm not surprised. Great, I'll try to be the best student I can. I'm starving, think I should grab some take-out from Sufi?
Speaker A: Of course! It's your favorite after all! Now you made me hungry! lol
Speaker B: Sorry for the typos and correction there's a restaurant here similar to Sufi's in London. They sell delicious Donairs, you should definitely try them out sometime. 

MEMORY 1:
Speaker A is pursuing an athletic training degree in college, teaching jiu-jitsu, and is lactose intolerant. 
Speaker A is enrolled in a class on the history of martial arts and is majoring in athletic training. 
Both Speaker A and Speaker B are interested in martial arts and enjoy learning new things.

MEMORY 2:
User Description:
Speaker B is a software tech from England who is very active and loves running marathons. They also teach jiu-jitsu and have a foster home for dogs. Speaker B is planning to take summer courses soon and has considered adopting a dog in the states, but feels it would be disloyal to their dogs in England. They miss their dogs and London very much, and their favorite restaurant in London is Sufi.

Relationship Description:
Speaker B and Speaker A have been working on the same project and have discussed planning a trip to England together. Speaker A enrolled in a class on the history of martial arts, which Speaker A thinks Speaker B would enjoy. They have shared information about their favorite restaurants, with Speaker A loving Taco Bell.

Event Description:
Speaker B is busy with software work and has not had much time to do other activities. They are considering planning a trip to England to visit family and friends, as well as their dogs. Speaker B recently signed up for a class teaching the history of martial arts, while Speaker A is studying for an athletic training degree. Speaker A loves teaching and learning, especially about the history of martial arts.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:
Explanation: 
Memory 1 provides relevant information about Speaker A's degree and their involvement in teaching and studying martial arts, which directly aligns with the dialogue focus on martial arts classes, teaching styles, and interests. It shows Speaker A's expertise and passion for martial arts, which is helpful for the context.

Memory 2, while providing a broader description of Speaker B's background and some mutual interests, includes several details that are not directly related to the current conversation. It repeats some information already known (Sufi being Speaker B's favorite restaurant) but adds more unrelated facts about Speaker B's activities and emotional perspective.

Choice: 1
